p: Chronic Hepatitis B (CHB) is caused by the hepadnavirus hepatitis B virus (HBV), which targets the liver leading to a severe medical condition. Recent global statistics from the World Health Organization (WHO) estimated that 257 million people carried the virus in 2015 [ 208]. HBV is an enveloped virus that is coated with a lipid bilayer and packaged with viral polymerase, relaxed circular DNA (rcDNA), and three types of antigens: surface antigen (HBsAg), e antigen (HBeAg), and core antigen (HBcAg). Upon infection, rcDNA is converted into the host-specific covalently closed circular DNA (cccDNA) by the viral polymerase, which plays a critical role in HBV replication [ 165, 146, 75].
